column4: Hi all... I have weird problem. I press volume up on my Gigabyte i1520M and it "stucks" even if it's not pressed... Instead of "Vol+" it does "Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+" until swiched to another TTY and returned to TTY 7... Do you know how to solve it?

Hi all... I have weird problem. I press volume up on my Gigabyte i1520M and it "stucks" even if it's not pressed... Instead of "Vol+" it does "Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+Vol+" until swiched to another TTY and returned to TTY 7... Do you know how to solve it? (BUMPing)
This is built in KB in Gygabyte i1520M
sometimes bios updates patch issues related to ps/2..
did u try updating the bios?
In Windows it works nice... Bios should be latest (the only one released)
is this for X or for console?
somebody from ubuntu-cz adviced patching /lib/udev/rules.d/95-keyboard-force-release.rules... How to do it?
http://www.gigabyte.com/products/product-page.aspx?pid=3363#bios < u should be able to update the bios to 009 from windows easily
look at that file... I just need to add line like this:
can u paste the source document to this site? (just the url)
i worded that badly.. just the url u can paste.. so i can see what that udev stuff is
It was guy from #ubuntu-cz who told be this...
do u get "reset" in dmesg ?, try hitting the key.. then after in another tty do "dmesg" .. see if anything "reset" is related to the keyboard
let us go PM, this is jungle...
